event: stung on the face and neck by several bees
no problems for the rest of the day
presented to the ED reporting “the worst pain in my life”
lack of findings on physical exam
prominent gas within anterior compartment of the right thigh
incision extended toward the greater trochanter
muscle bulged out confirming compartment syndrome
dressings changed wet to dry twice daily
Clostridium perfringens identified from wound cultures
antibiotics changed to ertapenem 500 mg IV
excisional debridement of fascia and muscle
